marc:datafield.marc:subfield: Substantial sections from an illustrated treatise titled Book of the balance of wisdom, which concerns measurement of weight, with a historical introduction to theories of gravity and weighing in Greek and Arabic science; tables of densities of substances including metals, precious stones, solids, and liquids; and descriptions of different types of balances. A few marginal notes are present. A few catchwords and some minuscule letters under undotted letters have been added by later hands. Damage to edges of many leaves.
Script: Written in naskh script, with headings in larger riqa' script.
Decoration: 26 diagrams and 18 tables in red and black ink.
Binding: Unbound, with some partial gatherings still joined or repaired at gutter.
Origin: Written ca. 1270 (based on paper and script).
Sold by Sam Fogg Ltd., cat. 22 (2000), to Lawrence J. Schoenberg.
Deposit by Lawrence J. Schoenberg and Barbara Brizdle, 2011.
Described in Transformation of knowledge: early manuscripts from the collection of Lawrence J. Schoenberg (London: Paul Holberton, 2006),
Lawrence J. Schoenberg & Barbara Brizdle Manuscript Initiative.
Book of the balance of wisdom.
The Lawrence J. Schoenberg and Barbara Brizdle Manuscript Initiative Fund Home Page

recordinfo.str: 98 leaves : paper, col. ill. ; 195 x 160 (145 x 110) mm.

Substantial sections from an illustrated treatise titled Book of the balance of wisdom, which concerns measurement of weight, with a historical introduction to theories of gravity and weighing in Greek and Arabic science; tables of densities of substances including metals, precious stones, solids, and liquids; and descriptions of different types of balances. A few marginal notes are present. A few catchwords and some minuscule letters under undotted letters have been added by later hands. Damage to edges of many leaves.
Script: Written in naskh script, with headings in larger riqa' script.
Decoration: 26 diagrams and 18 tables in red and black ink.
Binding: Unbound, with some partial gatherings still joined or repaired at gutter.
Origin: Written ca. 1270 (based on paper and script).
Rare Book & Manuscript Library University of Pennsylvania LJS 386
